intro: Fagelia polyrhiza, commonly known as the many-stemmed fagelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Fagelia polyrhiza is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
